<command-message>docs is running‚Ä¶</command-message>
<command-name>/docs</command-name>
<command-args>look for tag definitions like the classic xml or any defined tags</command-args>

content.text:
Execute the Claude Code Docs helper script at ~/.claude-code-docs/claude-docs-helper.sh

Usage:
- /docs - List all available documentation topics
- /docs <topic> - Read specific documentation with link to official docs
- /docs -t - Check sync status without reading a doc
- /docs -t <topic> - Check freshness then read documentation
- /docs whats new - Show recent documentation changes (or "what's new")

Examples of expected output:

When reading a doc:
üìö COMMUNITY MIRROR: https://github.com/ericbuess/claude-code-docs
üìñ OFFICIAL DOCS: https://docs.anthropic.com/en/docs/claude-code

[Doc content here...]

üìñ Official page: https://docs.anthropic.com/en/docs/claude-code/hooks

When showing what's new:
üìö Recent documentation updates:

‚Ä¢ 5 hours ago:
  üìé https://github.com/ericbuess/claude-code-docs/commit/eacd8e1
  üìÑ data-usage: https://docs.anthropic.com/en/docs/claude-code/data-usage
     ‚ûï Added: Privacy safeguards
  üìÑ security: https://docs.anthropic.com/en/docs/claude-code/security
     ‚ú® Data flow and dependencies section moved here

üìé Full changelog: https://github.com/ericbuess/claude-code-docs/commits/main/docs
üìö COMMUNITY MIRROR - NOT AFFILIATED WITH ANTHROPIC

Every request checks for the latest documentation from GitHub (takes ~0.4s).
The helper script handles all functionality including auto-updates.

Execute: ~/.claude-code-docs/claude-docs-helper.sh "look for tag definitions like the classic xml or any defined tags"
I'll search the Claude Code documentation for information about tag definitions, including XML-like tags and other defined tags.

input.command: ~/.claude-code-docs/claude-docs-helper.sh "look for tag definitions like the classic xml or any defined tags"
input.description: Search Claude Code docs for tag definitions

content.text: Let me search more broadly for tag definitions and angle bracket patterns:

content.content:
docs/sub-agents.md:Include specific examples of how to fix issues.
docs/sub-agents.md:* **Write detailed prompts**: Include specific instructions, examples, and constraints in your system prompts. The more guidance you provide, the better the subagent will perform.
docs/settings.md:**Configuration example:**
docs/settings.md:| `MAX_THINKING_TOKENS`                      | Enable [extended thinking](/en/docs/build-with-claude/extended-thinking) and set the token budget for the thinking process. Extended thinking improves performance on complex reasoning and coding tasks but impacts [prompt caching efficiency](/en/docs/build-with-claude/prompt-caching#caching-with-thinking-blocks). Disabled by default. |
docs/settings.md:For example, you could automatically run a Python formatter after Claude
docs/plugins.md:For complete instructions including configuration examples, marketplace setup, and rollout best practices, see [Configure team marketplaces](/en/docs/claude-code/plugin-marketplaces#how-to-configure-team-marketplaces).
docs/statusline.md:* Use `jq` for JSON parsing in Bash (see examples above)
docs/output-styles.md:  [plugins](/en/docs/claude-code/plugins) instead. ([example
docs/iam.md:A rule that is just the tool name matches any use of that tool. For example, adding `Bash` to the list of allow rules would allow Claude Code to use the Bash tool without requiring user approval.
docs/iam.md:* `WebFetch(domain:example.com)` Matches fetch requests to example.com
docs/changelog.md:- Fixed a bug where `/context` would sometimes fail with "max_tokens must be greater than thinking.budget_tokens" error message
docs/changelog.md:- SDK: added --max-budget-usd flag
docs/changelog.md:- IDE: Add toggle to enable/disable thinking.
docs/changelog.md:- Fix ultrathink + thinking toggle
docs/changelog.md:- /context: Fix counting for thinking blocks
docs/changelog.md:- Tab to toggle thinking (sticky across sessions)
docs/changelog.md:- Fixed thinking mode triggering on negation phrases like "don't think"
docs/changelog.md:- Fixed a bug where resuming a conversation in headless mode would sometimes enable thinking unnecessarily
docs/changelog.md:- Fix thinking mode not working in headless sessions
docs/changelog.md:- Improve thinking mode display with enhanced visual effects
docs/changelog.md:- Type /t to temporarily disable thinking mode in your prompt
docs/changelog.md:- Custom slash commands: Restored namespacing in command names based on subdirectories. For example, .claude/commands/frontend/component.md is now /frontend:component, not /component.
docs/changelog.md:- Custom slash commands: Run bash output, @-mention files, enable thinking with thinking keywords
docs/changelog.md:- Added support for triggering thinking non-English languages
docs/changelog.md:- Added `DISABLE_INTERLEAVED_THINKING` to give users the option to opt out of interleaved thinking.
docs/changelog.md:- Fixed a bug where thinking was not working in -p mode
docs/changelog.md:- Improved thinking triggering reliability
docs/changelog.md:- Ask Claude to make a plan with thinking mode: just say 'think' or 'think harder' or even 'ultrathink'
docs/gitlab-ci-cd.md:1. **Event-driven orchestration**: GitLab listens for your chosen triggers (for example, a comment that mentions `@claude` in an issue, MR, or review thread). The job collects context from the thread and repository, builds prompts from that input, and runs Claude Code.
docs/gitlab-ci-cd.md:3. **Add the Claude job to `.gitlab-ci.yml`** (see examples below)

content.content:
docs/mcp.md:claude mcp add --transport stdio <name> <command> [args...]
docs/sandboxing.md:npx @anthropic-ai/sandbox-runtime <command-to-sandbox>
docs/slash-commands.md:/<command-name> [arguments]
docs/slash-commands.md:| `<command-name>` | Name derived from the Markdown filename (without `.md` extension) |
